column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=II
#Text=As Wyant emerged from the house he paused once more to glance up at its scarred brick facade .
#Text=The marble hand drooped tragically above the entrance : in the waning light it seemed to have relaxed into the passiveness of despair , and Wyant stood musing on its hidden meaning .
#Text=But the Dead Hand was not the only mysterious thing about Doctor Lombard ’s house .
#Text=What were the relations between Miss Lombard and her father ?
#Text=Above all , between Miss Lombard and her picture ?
#Text=She did not look like a person capable of a disinterested passion for the arts ; and there had been moments when it struck Wyant that she hated the picture .

#Text=The sky at the end of the street was flooded with turbulent yellow light , and the young man turned his steps toward the church of San Domenico , in the hope of catching the lingering brightness on Sodoma ’s St. Catherine .
#Text=The great bare aisles were almost dark when he entered , and he had to grope his way to the chapel steps .
#Text=Under the momentary evocation of the sunset , the saint ’s figure emerged pale and swooning from the dusk , and the warm light gave a sensual tinge to her ecstasy .
#Text=The flesh seemed to glow and heave , the eyelids to tremble ; Wyant stood fascinated by the accidental collaboration of light and color .
#Text=Suddenly he noticed that something white had fluttered to the ground at his feet .
#Text=He stooped and picked up a small thin sheet of note-paper , folded and sealed like an old-fashioned letter , and bearing the superscription : --
#Text=To the Count Ottaviano Celsi .
#Text=Wyant stared at this mysterious document .
#Text=Where had it come from ?
#Text=He was distinctly conscious of having seen it fall through the air , close to his feet .
#Text=He glanced up at the dark ceiling of the chapel ; then he turned and looked about the church .
#Text=There was only one figure in it , that of a man who knelt near the high altar .
#Text=Suddenly Wyant recalled the question of Doctor Lombard ’s maid-servant .
#Text=Was this the letter she had asked for ?
#Text=Had he been unconsciously carrying it about with him all the afternoon ?
#Text=Who was Count Ottaviano Celsi , and how came Wyant to have been chosen to act as that nobleman ’s ambulant letter-box ?

#Text=Wyant laid his hat and stick on the chapel steps and began to explore his pockets , in the irrational hope of finding there some clue to the mystery ; but they held nothing which he had not himself put there , and he was reduced to wondering how the letter , supposing some unknown hand to have bestowed it on him , had happened to fall out while he stood motionless before the picture .
#Text=At this point he was disturbed by a step on the floor of the aisle , and turning , he saw his lustrous-eyed neighbor of the table d’hote .
#Text=The young man bowed and waved an apologetic hand .
#Text=“ I do not intrude ? ” he inquired suavely .
#Text=Without waiting for a reply , he mounted the steps of the chapel , glancing about him with the affable air of an afternoon caller .
#Text=“ I see , ” he remarked with a smile , “ that you know the hour at which our saint should be visited . ”
#Text=Wyant agreed that the hour was indeed felicitous .
#Text=The stranger stood beamingly before the picture .
#Text=“ What grace !
#Text=What poetry ! ” he murmured , apostrophizing the St. Catherine , but letting his glance slip rapidly about the chapel as he spoke .
#Text=Wyant , detecting the manoeuvre , murmured a brief assent .
#Text=“ But it is cold here -- mortally cold ; you do not find it so ? ”
#Text=The intruder put on his hat .
#Text=“ It is permitted at this hour -- when the church is empty .
#Text=And you , my dear sir -- do you not feel the dampness ?
#Text=You are an artist , are you not ?
#Text=And to artists it is permitted to cover the head when they are engaged in the study of the paintings . ”
#Text=He darted suddenly toward the steps and bent over Wyant ’s hat .
#Text=“ Permit me -- cover yourself ! ” he said a moment later , holding out the hat with an ingratiating gesture .
#Text=A light flashed on Wyant .
#Text=“ Perhaps , ” he said , looking straight at the young man , “ you will tell me your name .
#Text=My own is Wyant . ”
#Text=The stranger , surprised , but not disconcerted , drew forth a coroneted card , which he offered with a low bow .
#Text=On the card was engraved : --
#Text=Il Conte Ottaviano Celsi .
#Text=“ I am much obliged to you , ” said Wyant ; “ and I may as well tell you that the letter which you apparently expected to find in the lining of my hat is not there , but in my pocket . ”
#Text=He drew it out and handed it to its owner , who had grown very pale .
#Text=“ And now , ” Wyant continued , “ you will perhaps be good enough to tell me what all this means . ”
#Text=There was no mistaking the effect produced on Count Ottaviano by this request .
#Text=His lips moved , but he achieved only an ineffectual smile .
#Text=“ I suppose you know , ” Wyant went on , his anger rising at the sight of the other ’s discomfiture , “ that you have taken an unwarrantable liberty .
#Text=I do n’t yet understand what part I have been made to play , but it ’s evident that you have made use of me to serve some purpose of your own , and I propose to know the reason why . ”
#Text=Count Ottaviano advanced with an imploring gesture .
#Text=“ Sir , ” he pleaded , “ you permit me to speak ? ”
#Text=“ I expect you to , ” cried Wyant .
#Text=“ But not here , ” he added , hearing the clank of the verger ’s keys .
#Text=“ It is growing dark , and we shall be turned out in a few minutes . ”
